data.title: Meaning of KIDS (OneRepublic)
data.meta_description: OneRepublic's song 'Kids' is a vibrant anthem that captures the essence of youth and the nostalgia for the past, while also embracing the present and...
data.text:
OneRepublic's song 'Kids' is a vibrant anthem that captures the essence of youth and the nostalgia for the past, while also embracing the present and future. The lyrics, penned by the band's lead vocalist Ryan Tedder, reflect on the carefree and adventurous days of youth, characterized by a sense of invincibility and the desire to escape the confines of one's hometown. The repeated line 'Back when we were kids, swore we would never die' encapsulates the youthful feeling of immortality and the belief that anything is possible.

The song also touches on the theme of growth and change. Despite the fond memories of the past, the lyrics 'I refuse to look back thinking days were better, just because they're younger days' suggest a recognition that idealizing the past is not productive. Instead, the song encourages listeners to appreciate the present and look forward to the future without fear of change. This sentiment is reinforced by the line 'I don't know what's 'round the corner, way I feel right now, I swear we'll never change,' which conveys a commitment to maintaining the spirit of youth, regardless of age or circumstance.

Musically, 'Kids' is upbeat and anthemic, with a sound that complements the song's themes of freedom and nostalgia. OneRepublic is known for their pop-rock style that often incorporates elements of alternative rock, pop, and electronic music. 'Kids' is a testament to the band's ability to craft songs that resonate with a wide audience, blending catchy melodies with thought-provoking lyrics. The song serves as a reminder that while we all grow up, the feelings and experiences of our youth continue to shape who we are.
